intro: Prosopanche costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while the stems are erect and covered in fine hairs. The plant is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
